Computer security, also known as cybersecurity, refers to the practices, technologies, and processes designed to protect computer systems, networks, and sensitive information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction. This includes protection against malware, viruses, Trojan horses, spyware, adware, ransomware, and other types of malicious software. Effective computer security involves implementing controls such as firewalls, access controls, encryption, and intrusion detection systems to prevent cyber threats and minimize their impact when they occur. Research is ongoing to develop new and improved security technologies and protocols.
